history.proof: unfold ex_lim. exists a. apply is_lim_const.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
a: R
x: Rbar

Goal:
ex_lim (fun _ : R => a) x

Premises:
ex_lim = fun (f : R -> R) (x : Rbar) => exists l : Rbar, is_lim f x l : (R -> R) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
*** [ R : Set ]
is_lim_const : forall (a : R) (x : Rbar), is_lim (fun _ : R => a) x a
ex_lim_comp : forall (f g : R -> R) (x : Rbar), ex_lim f (Lim g x) -> ex_lim g x -> Rbar_locally' x (fun y : R => g y <> Lim g x) -> ex_lim (fun x0 : R => f (g x0)) x
ex_lim_id : forall x : Rbar, ex_lim (fun y : R => y) x
ex_lim_ext_loc : forall (f g : R -> R) (x : Rbar), Rbar_locally' x (fun y : R => f y = g y) -> ex_lim f x -> ex_lim g x
filterlim_Rbar_mult_r : forall (a : R) (l : Rbar), filterlim (fun x : R => x * a) (Rbar_locally l) (Rbar_locally (Rbar_mult l a))
Lim_comp : forall (f g : R -> R) (x : Rbar), ex_lim f (Lim g x) -> ex_lim g x -> Rbar_locally' x (fun y : R => g y <> Lim g x) -> Lim (fun x0 : R => f (g x0)) x = Lim f (Lim g x)
ex_lim_ext : forall (f g : R -> R) (x : Rbar), (forall y : R, f y = g y) -> ex_lim f x -> ex_lim g x
filter_prod_proper = fun (T1 T2 : Type) (F : (T1 -> Prop) -> Prop) (G : (T2 -> Prop) -> Prop) (FF : ProperFilter F) (FG : ProperFilter G) => {| filter_ex := fun (P : T1 * T2 -> Prop) (H : filter_prod F G P) => match H with | @Filter_prod _ _ _ _ _ Q1 Q2 H1 H2 HP => (fun _evar_0_ : forall (x : T1) (p : (fun x0 : T1 => Q1 x0) x), (fun _ : exists x0 : T1, Q1 x0 => exists x0 : T1 * T2, P x0) (ex_intro (fun x0 : T1 => Q1 x0) x p) => match filter_ex Q1 H1 as e return ((fun _ : exists x : T1, Q1 x => exists x : T1 * T2, P x) e) with | @ex_intro _ _ x x0 => _evar_0_ x x0 end...
open_false = fun (T : UniformSpace) (x : T) (Hx : False) => False_ind (locally x (fun _ : T => False)) Hx : forall T : UniformSpace, open (fun _ : T => False) Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted
Lim_correct : forall (f : R -> R) (x : Rbar), ex_lim f x -> is_lim f x (Lim f x)
filterlim_Rbar_mult_l : forall (a : R) (l : Rbar), filterlim (Rmult a) (Rbar_locally l) (Rbar_locally (Rbar_mult a l))
ex_finite_lim_correct : forall (f : R -> R) (x : Rbar), ex_finite_lim f x < -> ex_lim f x /\ is_finite (Lim f x)
eventually_filter = {| filter_ex := fun (P : nat -> Prop) (H0 : eventually P) => match H0 with | @ex_intro _ _ N H => ex_intro (fun x : nat => P x) N (H N (Nat.le_refl N)) end; filter_filter := {| filter_true := ex_intro (fun N : nat => forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> True) 0%nat (fun (n : nat) (_ : (0 <= n)%nat) => I); filter_and := fun (P Q : nat -> Prop) (H : eventually P) => match H with | @ex_intro _ _ NP HP => fun H0 : eventually Q => match H0 with | @ex_intro _ _ NQ HQ => ex_intro (fun N : nat => forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> P n /\ Q n) (Init.Nat.max NP NQ) (fun (n : nat) (Hn : (Init.Nat.max NP NQ <= n)%nat) => conj (HP n (Nat.le_trans NP (Init.Nat.max NP NQ) n (Max...
is_lim' = fun (f : R -> R) (x l : Rbar) => match l with | Finite l0 => forall eps : posreal, Rbar_locally' x (fun y : R => Rabs (f y - l0) < eps) | p_infty => forall M : R, Rbar_locally' x (fun y : R => M < f y) | m_infty => forall M : R, Rbar_locally' x (fun y : R => f y < M) end : (R -> R) -> Rbar -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _ _]
filterlim_const : forall a0 : ?U, filterlim (fun _ : ?T => a0) ?F (locally a0) where ?T : [a : R x : Rbar |- Type] ?U : [a : R x : Rbar |- UniformSpace] ?F : [a : R x : Rbar |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [a : R x : Rbar |- Filter ?F]
open_true = fun (T : UniformSpace) (x : T) (_ : True) => filter_true : forall T : UniformSpace, open (fun _ : T => True) Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted
is_lim_id : forall x : Rbar, is_lim (fun y : R => y) x x
Build_Filter : forall (T : Type) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop), F (fun _ : T => True) -> (forall P Q : T -> Prop, F P -> F Q -> F (fun x : T => P x /\ Q x)) -> (forall P Q : T -> Prop, (forall x : T, P x -> Q x) -> F P -> F Q) -> Filter F
Record Filter (T : Type) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop) : Prop := Build_Filter { filter_true : F (fun _ : T => True); filter_and : forall P Q : T -> Prop, F P -> F Q -> F (fun x : T => P x /\ Q x); filter_imp : forall P Q : T -> Prop, (forall x : T, P x -> Q x) -> F P -> F Q } For Filter: Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted For Filter: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope] For Build_Filter: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope _ function_scope function_scope]
is_lim_comp : forall (f g : R -> R) (x k l : Rbar), is_lim f l k -> is_lim g x l -> Rbar_locally' x (fun y : R => g y <> l) -> is_lim (fun x0 : R => f (g x0)) x k
locally' = fun (T : UniformSpace) (x : T) => within (fun y : T => y <> x) (locally x) : forall T : UniformSpace, T -> (T -> Prop) -> Prop Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope]
ex_Rbar_mult = fun x y : Rbar => match x with | Finite x0 => match y with | Finite _ => True | _ => x0 <> 0 end | _ => match y with | Finite y0 => y0 <> 0 | _ => True end end : Rbar -> Rbar -> Prop
real = fun x : Rbar => match x with | Finite x0 => x0 | _ => 0 end : Rbar -> R real is a coercion
open_Rbar_lt : forall y : Rbar, open (fun u : R => Rbar_lt u y)
open_lt : forall y : R, open (fun u : R => u < y)
open_gt : forall y : R, open (fun u : R => y < u)
open_Rbar_gt : forall y : Rbar, open (fun u : R => Rbar_lt y u)
open_Rbar_lt' : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_lt x y -> Rbar_locally x (fun u : R => Rbar_lt u y)
Lub.is_ub_Rbar_opp : forall (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), Lub.is_lb_Rbar E l < -> Lub.is_ub_Rbar (fun x : R => E (- x)) (Rbar_opp l)
Lub.is_glb_Rbar_opp : forall (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), Lub.is_lub_Rbar E l < -> Lub.is_glb_Rbar (fun x : R => E (- x)) (Rbar_opp l)
Lub.is_lb_Rbar_opp : forall (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), Lub.is_ub_Rbar E l < -> Lub.is_lb_Rbar (fun x : R => E (- x)) (Rbar_opp l)
is_lim_comp_seq : forall (f : R -> R) (u : nat -> R) (x l : Rbar), is_lim f x l -> eventually (fun n : nat => u n <> x) -> is_lim_seq u x -> is_lim_seq (fun n : nat => f (u n)) l
Lim_ext_loc : forall (f g : R -> R) (x : Rbar), Rbar_locally' x (fun y : R => f y = g y) -> Lim g x = Lim f x
is_lim_comp' : forall (f : ?T -> R) (g : R -> R) (x0 l : Rbar), filterlim f ?F (Rbar_locally x0) -> is_lim g x0 l -> ?F (fun y : ?T => f y <> x0) -> filterlim (fun y : ?T => g (f y)) ?F (Rbar_locally l) where ?T : [a : R x : Rbar |- Type] ?F : [a : R x : Rbar |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [a : R x : Rbar |- Filter ?F]
Lub.is_lb_Rbar_correct : forall (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), Lub.is_lb_Rbar E l < -> Lub.Rbar_is_lower_bound (fun x : Rbar => is_finite x /\ E x) l
Lub.is_ub_Rbar_correct : forall (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), Lub.is_ub_Rbar E l < -> Lub.Rbar_is_upper_bound (fun x : Rbar => is_finite x /\ E x) l
Lub.is_lub_Rbar_correct : forall (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), Lub.is_lub_Rbar E l < -> Lub.Rbar_is_lub (fun x : Rbar => is_finite x /\ E x) l

is_lim_ext_loc : forall (f g : R -> R) (x l : Rbar), Rbar_locally' x (fun y : R => f y = g y) -> is_lim f x l -> is_lim g x l
INR = fix INR (n : nat) : R := match n with | 0%nat => 0 | 1%nat => 1 | S (S _ as n0) => INR n0 + 1 end : nat -> R Argument scope is [nat_scope]

Qed.```
